data.title: Postclassic and Colonial Sites of the Upper Grijalva River Basin in Chiapas, Mexico: Los Encuentros, Coapa, and Coneta, Paper 86 (Papers of the New World Archaeological Foundation #86)
data.meta_description: This Paper presents key findings on the Postclassic and early Colonial eras in Chiapas. The sites of Los Encuentros, Coapa, and Coneta were excavated as part of the larger Upper Grijalva River Basin regional project and offshoot Colonial Coxoh Maya projects with the goal of understanding the impacts to indigenous communities after the Spanish Conquest.
